did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: International Society for Comparative Adult Education.

did.unittitle: International Society for Comparative Adult Education (ISCAE) Records
did.abstract: Small set of records from the International Society for Comparative Adult Education. Includes correspondence, minutes, agenda, material relating to book Comparative Adult Education, published 1998

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The International Society for Comparative Adult Education is a network of adult educators whose members come from more than 30 countries. The organization has its origins in 1960 in a working group put together by Dr. Alexander N. Charters and Roby Kidd that focused on international and comparative adult education. The organization was known as the Committee for Study and Research in Comparative Adult Education (CSRCA) until 1992, when it adopted its current name.

The network requires no statutes, no accounting or membership fees; although it does publish occasional papers the primary venue for exchange of information is the conferences held annually in various locations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The International Society for Comparative Adult Education (ISCAE) Records consist of a single box containing assorted records. The material includes correspondence, minutes, agendas, material relating to book Comparative Adult Education, published 1998, and similar material. The collection has not yet been processed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has more than 50 collections related to adult education. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete list.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The collection is currently unprocessed and not available for research. Please contact &scrc_name; for more information.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
